results.title: Muscles and movement
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
Designed for 11 to 14 year olds, the film illustrates aspects of the skeleton and muscles, using resources not available in the classroom or school laboratory. Uses clinical techniques, anatomical models and preparations selected to demonstrate body functions.
results.description:

results.title: The Lymphatic system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
Animation and live photography are used to demonstrate blood flow in the capillary system and investigate the nature of the lymphatic system. No other credits available.

results.title: New generations
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
The mechanism of human reproduction are explained and illustrated. A sequence showing the birth of a baby is included. The film is intended for children 12-14 years.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
One of a series of films using resources not available in the classroom. This is the introductory film to the series, and is a general outline of human anatomy and physiology.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
This film uses resources not available in the classroom or school laboratory to show aspects of anatomy and physiology. This film in the series shows the body’s enemies and how the body defends itself.

results.title: The Breath of Life
results.creator_credit: Stuart Urban, Karl Sabbagh, Antenne-2 and Goldcrest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
An instructional training film showing the correct methods of applying mouth-to-mouth resuscitation in cases of drowning, electrocution and suffocation. The Holger-Nielson method of resuscitation is also shown in case the mouth-to-mouth method cannot be used.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stuart Urban, Karl Sabbagh, Antenne-2 and Goldcrest

results.title: Service Burnout
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Peter Quarry and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Service burnout is a stress reaction suffered by frontline and service staff. Addresses physical and emotional symptoms, effects on customer service, prevention of burnout and how to remedy existing cases of burnout.
